channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10942] support parallel request cancellation for multi-get
item.summary: support parallel request cancellation for multi-get

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: preliminary patch on top of a variation of hbase-10070 batch. TestAsyncProcess passes, probably need more testing.
Enis Soztutar Devaraj Das fyi
rebase on top of hbase-10070 branch
Nicolas Liochon it seems that this is your area of expertise.
yeah ping?

Unrelated to this patch, but related to multiget & replica


In AsyncProcess#receiveGlobalFailure

          if (firstAction) {  // <============== always false

            firstAction = false;  

            isReplica = !RegionReplicaUtil.isDefaultReplica(action.getReplicaId());

          }



   // [...]

   //    isReplica is always false here

      if (toReplay.isEmpty()) {

        logNoResubmit(server, numAttempt, rsActions.size(), t, isReplica, failed, stopped);

      } else {

        resubmit(server, toReplay, numAttempt, rsActions.size(), t, isReplica, selfTi);

      }



AsyncProcess#receiveMultiAction

Same as AsyncProcess#receiveGlobalFailure

Nits:

if (0 == ti.actionCount) {

yoda style spotted

if (e instanceof InterruptedIOException && (validateInterrupt() == null)) return;

Either it's very smart, either it's wrong, as a SocketTimeoutException is a IIOE. ExceptionUtil contains a method to check a Throwable.

// If we use interruption, we'll have to pre-create the syncronization structure

Typo on syncronization

validateInterrupt

I don't really understand what this method is doing. Some comments would be great.

private void groupAndSendMultiAction(List<Action<Row>> currentActions, int numAttempt, ThreadInfo selfTi) {

The javadoc should be updated here.

Not nit:
I think that useInterrupt should not be an option. It doubles the test cases, and it's not consistent with the simple get code.

The code is quite complex. Removing useInterruption will make it a little simpler. I'm not sure it will be enough to make it reasonably easy to understand.... There is as well some confusion between the Threads and and the future: we're cancelling tasks, not killing threads. I tend to think that it would be easier to read with a specific CompletionService?
isReplica there is only used for logging; fixed. Will fix rest and update the patch

About config - I think it's important to have way to turn off any new feature in case there's a bug in it... otherwise making new build and redeploying a cluster can be very costly for whoever is maintaining it.
Wrt confusion, I'll rename variables. What do you mean by having CompletionService i.e. what would we use it for
Updated and rebased patch. Uploaded RB with both old and new version (so diff could be shown): https://reviews.apache.org/r/21348/

I think it's important to have way to turn off any new feature in case there's a bug in it...

Yep, but the fact that the first code path does not work does not mean that the second one works better . Especially in this case, there are some nasty impacts if the threads are not interrupted.

What do you mean by having CompletionService i.e. what would we use it for

It would allow to put the thread management code in another class (like the code for the simple get case, a much simpler case, I agree).

1 - but it reduces the surface area. There's very little change to path when this feature is disabled... I've been burned by this in various distributed systems, most recently Hive (which is much easier to upgrade)

2 - can you give example? What code would be possible to move? We can move it. It uses thread pool right now...

1.

We're not gonna agree on this . As we are only two, we can't have a vote. Let's try to bring a third party?
It's not key per se, but simplifying the code is important here I think.

2.

It's the code related to ThreadInfo that could be moved (the BoundedCompletionService has a cancelAll function). I'm not saying it's trivial (hopefully it's possible!), but here as well I'm trying to have some simpler code in AsyncProcess.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12664655/10942.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12664655

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

This zip file has the 0.98 patch for this issue and couple of other issues (mentioned in the commit message in the patch). Attaching here for reference. Will have the finished versions of the referenced patches for the master branch soon.

Patch for master. This patch is basically the one that Nicolas Liochon had submitted sometime back (https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12664655/10942.patch), with a small change to do with using the Cancellable interface, and a unit test addition.

Time goes by
LGTM, +1

Patch looks good to me. +1 ... though which branch is this intended for? I thought 10070 branch was dead. The file name contains 1.1, so does that mean branch-1? Would be good to get branch-specific HadoopQA output for each target branch for this patch.
Thanks for the reviews, Nicolas Liochon and Nick Dimiduk. Great to see you, Nicolas Liochon! Attaching a patch for branch-1 (the previous one was for the master).
